segment.source: Overview of Advanced Group Policy Management
segment.target: Overview of Advanced Group Policy Management

segment.source: Overview of Advanced Group Policy Management
segment.target: Overview of Advanced Group Policy Management

segment.source: Overview of Advanced Group Policy Management
segment.target: Overview of Advanced Group Policy Management

segment.source: You can use Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) to extend the capabilities of the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) to provide comprehensive change control and improved management for Group Policy Objects (GPOs).
segment.target: You can use Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) to extend the capabilities of the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) to provide comprehensive change control and improved management for Group Policy Objects (GPOs).

segment.source: Group Policy object development with change control
segment.target: Group Policy object development with change control

segment.source: With AGPM, you can store a copy of each GPO in a central archive so that Group Policy administrators can view and change it offline without immediately affecting the deployed version of the GPO.
segment.target: With AGPM, you can store a copy of each GPO in a central archive so that Group Policy administrators can view and change it offline without immediately affecting the deployed version of the GPO.

segment.source: Additionally, AGPM stores a copy of each version of each controlled GPO in the archive so that you can roll back to an earlier version if necessary.
segment.target: Additionally, AGPM stores a copy of each version of each controlled GPO in the archive so that you can roll back to an earlier version if necessary.

segment.source: The terms "check in" and "check out" are used just as in a library (or in applications that provide change control, version control, or source control for programming development).
segment.target: The terms "check in" and "check out" are used just as in a library (or in applications that provide change control, version control, or source control for programming development).

segment.source: To use a book that is in a library, you check it out from the library.
segment.target: To use a book that is in a library, you check it out from the library.

segment.source: No one else can use it while you have it checked out.
segment.target: No one else can use it while you have it checked out.

segment.source: When you are finished with the book, you check it back into the library, so others can use it.
segment.target: When you are finished with the book, you check it back into the library, so others can use it.

segment.source: When you develop GPOs by using AGPM:
segment.target: When you develop GPOs by using AGPM:

segment.source: Create a new controlled GPO or control a previously uncontrolled GPO.
segment.target: Create a new controlled GPO or control a previously uncontrolled GPO.

segment.source: Check out the GPO, so that you and only you can change it.
segment.target: Check out the GPO, so that you and only you can change it.

segment.source: Edit the GPO.
segment.target: Edit the GPO.

segment.source: Check in the edited GPO, so that others can change it, or so that it can be deployed.
segment.target: Check in the edited GPO, so that others can change it, or so that it can be deployed.

segment.source: Review the changes.
segment.target: Review the changes.

segment.source: Deploy the GPO to the production environment.
segment.target: Deploy the GPO to the production environment.

segment.source: Role-based delegation
segment.target: Role-based delegation

segment.source: AGPM provides comprehensive, easy-to-use role-based delegation for managing access to GPOs in the archive.
segment.target: AGPM provides comprehensive, easy-to-use role-based delegation for managing access to GPOs in the archive.

segment.source: Domain-level permissions enable AGPM Administrators to provide access to individual domains without providing access to other domains.
segment.target: Domain-level permissions enable AGPM Administrators to provide access to individual domains without providing access to other domains.

segment.source: GPO-based delegation enables AGPM Administrators to provide access to specific GPOs without providing domain-wide access.
segment.target: GPO-based delegation enables AGPM Administrators to provide access to specific GPOs without providing domain-wide access.

segment.source: Within AGPM, there are specifically defined roles: AGPM Administrator (Full Control), Approver, Editor, and Reviewer.
segment.target: Within AGPM, there are specifically defined roles: AGPM Administrator (Full Control), Approver, Editor, and Reviewer.

segment.source: The AGPM Administrator role includes the permissions for all other roles.
segment.target: The AGPM Administrator role includes the permissions for all other roles.

segment.source: By default, only Approvers have the power to deploy GPOs to the production environment, protecting the environment from mistakes by less experienced Editors.
segment.target: By default, only Approvers have the power to deploy GPOs to the production environment, protecting the environment from mistakes by less experienced Editors.

segment.source: Also by default, all roles include the Reviewer role and therefore the ability to view GPO settings in reports.
segment.target: Also by default, all roles include the Reviewer role and therefore the ability to view GPO settings in reports.

segment.source: However, AGPM provides an AGPM Administrator with the flexibility to customize GPO access to fit the needs of your organization.
segment.target: However, AGPM provides an AGPM Administrator with the flexibility to customize GPO access to fit the needs of your organization.

segment.source: Delegation in a multiple Group Policy administrator environment
segment.target: Delegation in a multiple Group Policy administrator environment

segment.source: In an environment where multiple people change GPOs, an AGPM Administrator delegates permission to Editors, Approvers, and Reviewers, either as groups or as individuals.
segment.target: In an environment where multiple people change GPOs, an AGPM Administrator delegates permission to Editors, Approvers, and Reviewers, either as groups or as individuals.

segment.source: For a typical GPO development process for an Editor and an Approver, see Checklist: Create, Edit, and Deploy a GPO.
segment.target: For a typical GPO development process for an Editor and an Approver, see Checklist: Create, Edit, and Deploy a GPO.

segment.target: Additional references
